description: This story humorously explores the concept of North Americans staying warm in winter by tapping into their 'chill' factor.
title: Chill Factor
n_1: On a snowy winter day in North America, Jack Frost, embracing the cold, is outside.
c2_1: It's freezing! How can you stand it?
n_2: Wendy, bundled up, steps outside, shivering.
c1_2: You just need to find your inner 'chill' factor!
n_3: Jack demonstrates his carefree attitude towards the cold.
c1_3: Watch me make snow angels in a T-shirt!
c2_3: You're crazy, Jack! I need more layers.
n_4: Wendy tries to adapt, slightly loosening her scarf.
c1_4: See, you're getting the hang of it!
c2_4: Maybe there's something to this 'chill' factor after all.
